sen.j: 茨木 司（いばらき つかさ、生年不詳 - 慶応3年6月14日 (旧暦)（1867年7月15日））は、会津藩出身の新選組隊士。
sen.e: Tsukasa Ibaraki (year of birth unknown - July 15, 1867) was a member of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) from Aizu domain.
Tsukasa IBRAKI (year of birth unknown - July 15, 1867) was a member of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) from Aizu domain.

sen.j: 慶応元年（1865年）の入隊とされる。
sen.e: It is said that he joined Shinsengumi in 1865.
sen.cmt: 「入隊」は「新撰組に入隊」の意ですので、"joined Shinsengumi"としました。
sen.e: It is said that he joined Shinsengumi in 1865.

sen.j: 尊皇攘夷思想が強く、慶応3年3月に結成された伊東甲子太郎らの御陵衛士に参加を希望していたが、近藤勇がその才を惜しがったため残留。
sen.e: He had a strong thought of Sonno Joi (reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners) and wanted to join Goryo-eji (guards of Imperial mausoleums) led by Kashitaro ITO etc. formed in April 1867, but because Isami KONDO did not want to loose his talent, he remained.

sen.j: ただし、伊東より新選組の間者（スパイ）を頼まれていたと言われる。
sen.e: However, it is said that he was asked by Ito to be a Kanja (spy) of Shinsengumi.

sen.j: 同年6月に新選組の幕臣取り立てが決まると、反発して会津藩京都守護職邸に抗議を行ったが受け入れられず、佐野七五三之助、中村五郎、富川十郎らと共に、同所で自刃した。
sen.e: When Shinsengumi's promotion to Shogun's retainer was determined in July of the year, he revolted and protested to the house of Kyoto shugoshoku (Military governor of Kyoto) in Aizu domain, but was not accepted and committed suicide on the spot with Shimenosuke SANO, Goro NAKAMURA, Juro TOMIKAWA, and so on.
